fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Customs, Single market, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives: PBI's primary interests include but are not limited to:  posts, commerce, customs, security, trade. Specifically to e-Commerce and payments-related legislation and policy initiatives, such as Digital Agenda Strategy; Data Protection Regulation, IP Enforcement Directive, TTIP, competition policy, and consumer / consumer information legislation.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
AmChamEU (2017) 
EMOTA (2017) 
Member of EC Expert Group on Low Value Consignment Relief
goals__remit:
PBI delivers innovation that helps clients navigate the complex and ever evolving world of commerce - from helping clients use data to market to the best customers, to efficiently enabling the sending of parcels and packages, to securing payments through statements and invoices.  PBI delivers accuracy and precision to drive meaningful impact. 
 
PBI's business includes expertise in:  customer information management (improving data insight and performance), location intelligence (gaining business insights into specific places), customer engagement (speak to customers in a single voice across digital and physical channels), printing and delivery of impactful communication, global ecommerce software.
position: Vice President, Corporate and Regulatory Affairs
